answers.answer: It would be very uncommon for a woman your age to have heart disease. Is it possible, yes, but not very likely. Women of chilkd bearing age are generally protected from heart disease. What you describe does sound like anxiety issues. I understand your financial sitation, but the only way to know for sure is to see a doctor. There must be some clinics in your area that would see you and work something out, even state aid. You should see a dcotor to be sure and get some reassurance.Hope this helps, good luck!Jon

question: 3 years ago at 5 months pregnant the E.R. tech diagnosed me with anxiety/panic attacks which was not exactly confirmed by any means due to risking my pregnancy (they could only do an ultrasound to check for a blood clot)!A Little Info On Me:heart murmur very younghistory of heart disease, leaky heart valves,heart attacks, high blood pressure, lung cancer, asthma, emphysema, & diabetes in my family but not one was ever diagnosed with panic attacks........My Symptoms:hot flashes/sweatsshortness of breathtightening/pain in the chestlight-headed/dizzinesstingling/numbing of left armI am only 23 years old and have been experiencing this since i was 20 years old, i can not afford to see a doctor unless i go to the e.r. and just not pay my bill which i would hate to do!!! i very often wake up in the middle of the night with these symptoms and occasionally through the day at max 3-4 times per week and these so called attacks have gradually gotten worse since the time i was diagnosed with panic/anxiety attacks!! i am not quite sure what i am trying to ask but is there a possibility that may have some type of heart disease or am at risk for heart disease????? PLEASE ANYONE GIVE ME SOME ADVICE ON WHAT TO DO!!!!
title: hello i am new to the forum/need some advice!!!!
